intro: Cynoglossum himalayense, commonly known as Himalayan mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
